justification: Participants were "screened on the basis of dimensional psychopathology scores: Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9) … ≥ 10," indicating the PHQ-9 was used to quantify depression severity.

measured_by: Overall Anxiety Severity and Impairment Scale (OASIS)
justification: The study notes inclusion criteria of "Overall Anxiety Severity and Impairment Scale (OASIS) … ≥ 8," showing OASIS served as the instrument for measuring anxiety severity/impairment.
Eligibility was based on a "Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST-10) … score > 3," demonstrating the DAST-10 assessed drug-related problem severity.
The authors state they focused on "the Wide Range Achievement Test (WRAT), a common measure of premorbid IQ," linking WRAT to assessment of premorbid intelligence.
"Participants were grouped based on DSM-IV or DSM-5 diagnosis using the Mini International Neuropsychiatric Inventory (MINI)," indicating the MINI was the diagnostic instrument.

The Methods section states "We employed a commonly used three-armed bandit task to assess decision dynamics in the context of the explore/exploit dilemma," showing this task operationalized explore/exploit decision-making.
